==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Leut}} {{q|colloquial or poetic}} ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|gem-pro|h₁lewdʰ}} From {{inh|de|gmh|liute}}, from {{inh|de|goh|liuti}}, also {{m|goh|liudi}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*liudiz|*liudīz|people}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*h₁lewdʰ-||man, people}}. Compare {{cog|nl|[[lieden]], [[luden]], [[luiden]]|people}}, {{cog|non|lýðr|lýðir|people}} (whence {{cog|is|lýður}}), {{cog|osx|liudi}}, {{cog|ang|lēode||people}}, {{cog|en|lede||people}}, {{cog|got|*𐌻𐌹𐌿𐌸𐍃}}, {{cog|ru|люди}}, {{cog|bg|люде}}. More at [[leod]]. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈlɔʏ̯tə/}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Leute.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-Leute.ogg|Audio}} * {{homophones|de|läute|Läute}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|p|dim1=Leutchen|dim2=Leutlein}} # [[people]] {{gloss|several individual [[person]]s, a [[group]] of people in general, esp. of one kind or another}}, [[folk]] ([[folks]]), [[peeps]] {{q|[[slang]]}}, [[guys]] ([[boy]]s and/or [[girl]]s) ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-pl}} ====Usage notes==== * A backformed singular {{m|de|Leut|g=m||person}} may be heard in colloquial speech. It is rare and usually humorous. ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ===Noun 2=== {{head|de|noun}} # {{plural of|de|Leut}} [[Category:German pluralia tantum]]
